subject: Philosophy
title: Simone de Beauvoir
description: A quick, practical guide to Simone de Beauvoir.

hook.text: Simone de Beauvoir wrote: 'One is not born, but rather becomes, a woman.' Existentialism meets feminism.

buildup.text: In The Second Sex, she argued that society constructs gender roles â€” they're not natural facts.

discovery.text: She applied existentialism to oppression: women were denied freedom by being defined as 'the other.'

twist.text: Unlike Sartre, she emphasized that freedom isn't just individual. Social structures limit it.

climax.text: Her work launched modern feminism and showed that existentialism demands social justice, not just inner freedom.

punchline.text: Freedom means nothing if only some people have it.

quiz.question: What was Simone de Beauvoir's major contribution?
options: Applying existentialism to feminism and gender
